intro: Lastrea novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea lastrea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to red. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in a fine pubescence, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
